info.title: DocuSign Click API
info.description: DocuSign Click lets you capture consent to standard agreement terms with a single click: terms and conditions, terms of service, terms of use, privacy policies, and more. The Click API lets you include this customizable clickwrap solution in your DocuSign integrations.

get.summary: Gets the current version and other information about the Click API.

200.description: A successful response or an error

get.summary: Gets all the clickwraps for an account.
get.description: Gets all the clickwraps for an account.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
A GUID that identifies your account.
This value is automatically generated by
DocuSign for any account you create. Copy the
value from the **API Account ID** field in
the **API and Keys** page in
eSignature Settings

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: Optional. The earliest date to return agreements from

parameters.name: ownerUserId
parameters.description: Optional. The user ID of the owner

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: Optional. The page number to return

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Optional. The status of the clickwraps to filter by. One of:

- `active`
- `inactive`

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: Optional. The latest date to return agreements from

200.description: A successful response or an error

post.summary: Creates a clickwrap for an account.
post.description: Creates a clickwrap for an account and returns the response with created agreement.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
A GUID that identifies your account.
This value is automatically generated by
DocuSign for any account you create. Copy the
value from the **API Account ID** field in
the **API and Keys** page in
eSignature Settings

201.description: A successful response or an error

delete.description:
Deletes all clickwraps for an account
or only the ones specified in the
`clickwrapIds` query parameter.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
A GUID that identifies your account.
This value is automatically generated by
DocuSign for any account you create. Copy the
value from the **API Account ID** field in
the **API and Keys** page in
eSignature Settings

parameters.name: clickwrapIds
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of clickwrap IDs to delete

200.description: A successful response or an error

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
A GUID that identifies your account.
This value is automatically generated by
DocuSign for any account you create. Copy the
value from the **API Account ID** field in
the **API and Keys** page in
eSignature Settings

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The ID of the clickwrap

200.description: A successful response or an error

put.summary: Updates the user ID of a clickwrap.
put.description: Updates the user ID of a clickwrap. You specify the old and the new user ID in the request body.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
A GUID that identifies your account.
This value is automatically generated by
DocuSign for any account you create. Copy the
value from the **API Account ID** field in
the **API and Keys** page in
eSignature Settings

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The ID of the clickwrap

200.description: A successful response or an error

delete.summary: Deletes a clickwrap and all of its versions.
delete.description:
Deletes the clickwrap specified by `clickwrapId` and all of its versions.
Active clickwraps are not deleted

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
A GUID that identifies your account.
This value is automatically generated by
DocuSign for any account you create. Copy the
value from the **API Account ID** field in
the **API and Keys** page in
eSignature Settings

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The ID of the clickwrap

parameters.name: versions
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of versions to delete

200.description: A successful response or an error

post.summary: Checks if a user has agreed to a clickwrap.
post.description:
Checks if a user has agreed to a clickwrap and returns a response with the agreement URL.

Returns HTTP status code OK if the user has no pending agreement.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
A GUID that identifies your account.
This value is automatically generated by
DocuSign for any account you create. Copy the
value from the **API Account ID** field in
the **API and Keys** page in
eSignature Settings

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The ID of the clickwrap

201.description: A successful response or an error

get.summary: Gets a specific agreement for a specified clickwrap.
get.description:
Gets the agreement specified by `agreementId`.

You can omit `agreementId` to get the latest agreement.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
A GUID that identifies your account.
This value is automatically generated by
DocuSign for any account you create. Copy the
value from the **API Account ID** field in
the **API and Keys** page in
eSignature Settings

parameters.name: agreementId
parameters.description: The agreement ID

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The ID of the clickwrap

200.description: A successful response or an error

get.summary: Gets the completed user agreement PDF.
get.description:
Gets the PDF of  `agreementId` for the clickwrap specified by `ciickwrapId`.

The response to this method is the bytes of the PDF file.
The response includes the HTTP header `application/pdf.

delete.summary: Deletes the versions of a clickwrap.
delete.description:
Deletes all versions of a clickwrap,
or only the ones specified in the
`clickwrapVersionIds` query parameter.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
A GUID that identifies your account.
This value is automatically generated by
DocuSign for any account you create. Copy the
value from the **API Account ID** field in
the **API and Keys** page in
eSignature Settings

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The ID of the clickwrap

parameters.name: clickwrapVersionIds
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of clickwrap version IDs to delete

200.description: A successful response or an error

get.summary: Gets a specific version from a clickwrap.
get.description: Gets the version specified by `versionId`  from the clickwrap `clickwrapId`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
A GUID that identifies your account.
This value is automatically generated by
DocuSign for any account you create. Copy the
value from the **API Account ID** field in
the **API and Keys** page in
eSignature Settings

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The ID of the clickwrap

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version ID or the version number

200.description: A successful response or an error

put.summary: Updates a specific version of a clickwrap.
put.description: Updates the clickwrap version `versionId` of the clickwrap `clickwrapId`.

parameters.description:

This value is automatically generated by

value from the **API Account ID** field in

eSignature Settings

parameters.name: version

get.summary: Gets the agreement responses for a clickwrap version.
get.description: Gets the agreement responses for a specific version.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
A GUID that identifies your account.
This value is automatically generated by
DocuSign for any account you create. Copy the
value from the **API Account ID** field in
the **API and Keys** page in
eSignature Settings

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The ID of the clickwrap

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version ID of the version number

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: Optional. The earliest date to return agreements from

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: Optional. The page number to return

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Clickwrap status. Possible values:

- `active`
- `inactive`
- `deleted`

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: Optional. The latest date to return agreements from

200.description: A successful response or an error

requireReacceptance.description:
When **true**, requires signers who have previously agreed to this
clickwrap to sign again. The version number is incremented

transferFromUserId.description: The user ID of current owner of the clickwrap

transferToUserId.description: The user ID of the new owner of the clickwrap

scheduledDate.description: The time and date when this clickwrap is activated

fieldsToNull.description:
Specifies whether `scheduledReacceptance` and `scheduledDate` should be cleared. May be one of:

- `"scheduledReacceptance"`
- `"scheduledDate"`
- `"scheduledReacceptance,scheduledDate"`

isMajorVersion.description: When **true**, the next version created is a major version. When **false** the next version created is minor

ClickwrapRequest.description: Request body for working with clickwrap
ClickwrapRequest.x-ms-summary: Request body for working with clickwrap.

requireReacceptance.description:
When **true**, requires signers who have previously agreed to this
clickwrap to sign again. The version number is incremented

clickwrapVersionId.description: The unique version ID, a GUID, of this clickwrap version

lastModifiedBy.description: The user ID of the last user who modified this clickwrap

ownerUserId.description: The user ID of the owner of this clickwrap

createdTime.description: The time that the clickwrap was created

scheduledDate.description: The time and date when this clickwrap is activated

lastModified.description: The time that the clickwrap was last modified

recurrenceInterval.description:
The time between recurrences specified in `recurrenceIntervalType` units.

The minimum and maximum values depend on `recurrenceIntervalType`:

- `days`: 1 - 365
- `weeks`: 1 - 52
- `months`: 1 - 12
- `years`: 1

startDateTime.description: The date when the recurrence interval starts

recurrenceIntervalType.description:
The units of the `recurrenceInterval`. Must be one of:

- `days`
- `weeks`
- `month`
- `years`

clientUserId.description: The user ID of the client

declinedOn.description:
The date when the user declined the most recent required agreement.

This property is valid only when `status` is `declined`. Otherwise it is null

metadata.description: A customer-defined string you can use in requests. This string will appear in the corresponding response

agreementUrl.description:
When not null, an agreement is required for user specified by  `clientUserId`.

When missing the user specified by `clientUserId`
has already agreed and does not require a new acceptance.

Use this URL to render the agreement in a web page.

<!--
or redirected to when providing redirect_url as a query paramter.
-->

consumerDisclosureHtml.description: The customer-branded HTML with the Electronic Record and Signature Disclosure information

agreedOn.description:
Date that the client last completed the agreement.

This property is null if `agreementUrl` is not null and `status` is not  `agreed`

createdOn.description: The date when the clickwrap was created. May be null

accountId.description:
A GUID that identifies your account.
This value is automatically generated by
DocuSign for any account you create. Copy the
value from the **API Account ID** field in
the **API and Keys** page in
eSignature Settings

When **true**, requires signers who have previously agreed to this
clickwrap to sign again. The version number is incremented

lastModifiedBy.description: The user ID of the last user who modified this clickwrap

scheduledDate.description: The time and date when this clickwrap is activated

A GUID that identifies your account.
This value is automatically generated by
DocuSign for any account you create. Copy the
value from the **API Account ID** field in
the **API and Keys** page in
eSignature Settings

clickwrapVersionId.description: The unique version ID, a GUID, of this clickwrap version

ownerUserId.description: The user ID of the owner of this clickwrap

createdTime.description: The time that the clickwrap was created

lastModified.description: The time that the clickwrap was last modified

requireReacceptance.description:
When **true**, requires signers who have previously agreed to this
clickwrap to sign again. The version number is incremented

scheduledDate.description: The time and date when this clickwrap is activated

clickwrapVersionId.description: The unique version ID, a GUID, of this clickwrap version

ownerUserId.description: The user ID of the owner of this clickwrap

createdTime.description: The time that the clickwrap was created

deletionSuccess.description: **True** if the clickwrap was deleted successfully. **False** otherwise

lastModified.description: The time that the clickwrap was last modified

deletionMessage.description:
A message describing the result of deletion request. One of:

- `alreadyDeleted`: Clickwrap is already deleted.
- `deletionSuccess`: Successfully deleted the clickwrap.
- `deletionFailure`: Failed to delete the clickwrap.
- `cannotDelete`: Active clickwrap version cannot be deleted

fileExtension.description: The file extension of the document

documentBase64.description: The base64-encoded contents of the document

documentHtml.description: The HTML representation of the document

transferFromUserId.description: ID of the user to transfer from

transferToUserId.description: ID of the user to transfer to

accountId.description:
A GUID that identifies your account.
This value is automatically generated by
DocuSign for any account you create. Copy the
value from the **API Account ID** field in
the **API and Keys** page in
eSignature Settings

minimumPagesRemaining.description: Number of pages remaining in the response

pageSize.description: The number of items per page

page.description: The number of the current page

clickwrapVersionId.description: The unique version ID, a GUID, of this clickwrap version

ownerUserId.description: The user ID of the owner of this clickwrap

createdTime.description: The time that the clickwrap was created

lastModified.description: The time that the clickwrap was last modified

linkedSites.description: An array of URLs (strings) of related sites

clientUserId.description: The user ID of the client

metadata.description: A customer-defined string you can use in requests. This string will appear in the corresponding response

deletionSuccess.description: **True** if the clickwrap was deleted successfully. **False** otherwise

deletionMessage.description:
A message describing the result of deletion request. One of:

- `alreadyDeleted`: Clickwrap is already deleted.
- `deletionSuccess`: Successfully deleted the clickwrap.
- `deletionFailure`: Failed to delete the clickwrap.
- `cannotDelete`: Active clickwrap version cannot be deleted

versionUrl.description: The URL where this version of the API can be found

allowedHosts.description:
Hosts that can host the clickwrap.

It is an error if the clickwrap didn't come from one of these hosts

mustRead.description: **True** if the user needs to scroll to the end of the document

actionButtonAlignment.description:
Position of the Accept button in the agreement. One of 

- `right`
- `left`

declineButtonText.description: The text on the decline button

displayName.description: The display name of the user agreement

hasDeclineButton.description: **True** if the agreement has a decline checkbox

mustView.description: **True** if the user must view the document

recordDeclineResponses.description: When **true**, this agreement records decline actions

allowClientOnly.description: When **true**, this agreement can be be used in client-only integrations

sendToEmail.description: **True** if send to email is applicable

DisplaySettings.description: Information about how an agreement is displayed
DisplaySettings.x-ms-summary: Information about how an agreement is displayed.

minimumPagesRemaining.description: Number of pages remaining in the response

pageSize.description: The number of items per page

page.description: The number of the current page

x-ds-categories.name: Accounts
x-ds-categories.summary: DocuSign Click enables companies to capture consent to standard agreement terms with a single click.
x-ds-categories.description: DocuSign Click lets you capture consent to standard agreement terms with a single click: terms and conditions, terms of service, terms of use, privacy policies, and more. The Click API lets you include this customizable clickwrap solution in your DocuSign integrations.
